required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Clinical Activity of ThisCART19 in Patients With r/r Non-Hodgkin's B Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open and Single Dose-escalation Study to Evaluate the Safety and Clinical Activity of Allogeneic CAR-T Targeting CD19(ThisCART19) in Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory Non-Hodgkin's B Cell Lymphoma (r/r B-NHL)

collaborator.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: A single arm, open-label, dose-escalation study to evaluate the safety and clinical activity of ThisCART19 (Allogeneic CAR-T targeting CD19) in patients with relapsed and/or refractory non-Hodgkin's B cell lymphoma (r/r B-NHL).

detailed_description.textblock: ThisCART19 cell is a non-gene-editing allogeneic CAR-T cell targeting CD19. This study is designed to evaluate the safety and clinical activity of ThisCART19 in patients with CD19 positive, relapsed and/or refractory non-Hodgkin's B cell lymphoma (r/r B-NHL).

primary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of adverse events as assessed by NCI-CTCAE 5.0

secondary_outcome.description: The interval between administration and disease progression or death
The interval between administration and death caused by any reason
EFS is calculated from administration to death, progression of the disease, relapse or gene recurrence, whichever comes first, or last visit.

arm_group.description: In this study, allogeneic anti-CD19 CAR T Cells(ThisCART19 cells) is used to treat patients with refractory or relapsed CD19 positive B cell malignancies.

intervention.description: 0.2-60 x 10^6 CAR T cells per kg body weight

overall_official.affiliation: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

facility.name: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University
